remarks.para: Google's AdMob allows application developers to connect with advertisers and show relevant ads in their app. To use Google's AdMob, application developers must sign up with the Google AdMob service (http://www.google.com/ads/admob).
All uses of the AdMob service require the application developer's Publisher ID, which is available on the AdMob administrative Web page in the "Sites & Apps" section.

There are two types of AdMob ad: banner advertisements in standard IAB sizes and interstitial ads which are displayed at significant transition points in the application (startup, prior to video, etc.). Banner ads are represented by the class and interstitial ads are represented by the class.
